space.network

Class Connection

  • java.lang.Object
    • space.network.Connection

  • public class Connection
extends java.lang.Object
    Connection wraps a socket, providing a clean interface for reading and sending messages via the socket.
    Author:
    James Greenwood-Thessman (300289004)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Connection(java.net.Socket connectedSocket)
      Create a connection that wraps the socket.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the connection by closing the socket.
      boolean hasMessage()
      Whether a message has been received, and is able to be read.
      boolean isClosed()
      Whether the socket has been closed.
      Message readMessage()
      Reads a message that has been received from the socket.
      void sendMessage(Message message)
      Sends a message via the socket.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connection

        public Connection(java.net.Socket connectedSocket)
        Create a connection that wraps the socket.
        Parameters:
        connectedSocket - the socket to wrap

    • Method Detail

      • hasMessage

        public boolean hasMessage()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Whether a message has been received, and is able to be read.
        Returns:
        Whether a message has been received. Only the header must have been received before it is able to be read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Whether the socket has been closed.
        Returns:
        Whether the socket is closed.

      • readMessage

        public Message readMessage()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a message that has been received from the socket.
        Returns:
        The received message.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(Message message)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a message via the socket.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to send.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the connection by closing the socket.
